question.title: How to properly add selenium 4.31 to POM
question.body:
I am trying to use selenium in a java project, and I started using the pom in the example provided in the documentation:

https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/webdriver/getting_started/first_script/

This documentation leads to

https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/seleniumhq.github.io/blob/trunk/examples/java/src/test/java/dev/selenium/getting_started/FirstScript.java#L14

Now the pom is here https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/seleniumhq.github.io/blob/trunk/examples/java/pom.xml

It uses only two libraries:

<dependency>
            <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
            <artifactId>selenium-java</artifactId>
            <version>${selenium.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
            <artifactId>selenium-grid</artifactId>
            <version>${selenium.version}</version>
        </dependency>

But when I tried to do the same I got multiple methodNotFound errors. I added several more libraries and a BOM until my pom.xml has two pieces:


 <dependencyManagement>
      <dependencies>
        <dependency>
          <groupId>com.google.cloud</groupId>
          <artifactId>libraries-bom</artifactId>
          <version>${gcp-java-sdk-bom}</version>
          <type>pom</type>
          <scope>import</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
          <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
          <artifactId>selenium-dependencies-bom</artifactId>
          <version>4.31.0</version>
          <type>pom</type>
          <scope>import</scope>
        </dependency>

      </dependencies>
  </dependencyManagement>


   <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-java</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-grid</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-chrome-driver</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-remote-driver</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-manager</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
      <artifactId>selenium-api</artifactId>

    </dependency>

However I keep getting another error

'java.nio.file.Path org.openqa.selenium.internal.Require$PathStateChecker.isExecutable()'

This happens when trying to start the webdriver

 WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver();

Is there an example with a full pom somewhere? where can I download a dependency containing the package org.openqa.selenium.internal. ?
